text: Emanuel Diego Salvador Ruiz (born 7 July 1978)Emanuel Ruiz: By the elusive success is a former Argentine professional footballer, who played as a striker. ==Club career== He began his career in the youth sectors of Argentinos Juniors, being transferred with a group of youth footballers amongst them, Juan Roman Riquelme to Boca Juniors in 1996. on 10 August 1997 he made his debut with the first team the following year under Hector Veira in a 4–3 win over Rosario Central.Record and statistics in the First Division of Argentina However, he had no place at that time within the team and was loaned one year to Rosario Central, where he wasn't a first team regular either. In 1999, he returned to Boca, and this time under Carlos Bianchi's command, to have continuity in the main squad. In mid-2000 he was transferred to the Greek club AEK Athens. There after spending one season he was loaned to Union Santa Fe. Since then it has gone through several teams of Argentina, Mexico, Honduras, Israel and Peru, without actually settling in any of them. In 2008, he left for Israel by the club Hapoel Nir to play in the 2nd division of the country. Then in the middle of the following year, the club Cienciano of Cuzco, where he played 8 matches not having a good performance.Cienciano: Ciencias ocultas In January 2010, he joined everything was on track to become player San José however, a problem in his right knee prevented him from successfully pass medical exams and he did not sign for Bolivian club.Emanuel Ruiz fails in medicals ==References== ==External links== * Category:Living people Category:1978 births Category:Argentine footballers Category:People from Buenos Aires Category:Association football forwards Category:AEK Athens F.C. players Category:Real C.D.
